Hello world! This is Substrata.

A front-end skeleton project.

Get straight to work on what matters. Stop losing time on project setup. Lower the barrier to building a new site.

Substrata is a compilation of some of the best open source boilerplates and libraries on the web, a powerful set of grunt tasks to manage your workflow, and a minimalist collection of LESS mixins for many of the essentials you use all the time.

By typing these commands:

$ git clone https://github.com/shaunchurch/Substrata.git ~/my-new-project
$ cd ~/my-new-project
$ npm install
$ bower install
$ subl .
$ grunt server

You get these features ready to go:

  • Command line server for local development
  • Static site generation of pages and posts
  • Jade based templates
  • Markdown based 'posts' or blogging processor
  • Compile, lint and minify CSS, LESS, JavaScript, CoffeeScript, Jade with every file save
  • Live reload

Because all of this is accomplished using open tools like NPM, Bower, Grunt, and Git it's also completely extensible and customisable. You're not locked in to anything, and Substrata aims to stay out of your way, providing only enough to enable a painless beginning. Where you go from here is up to you.

Why are you doing this?

There are some superb tools and frameworks around that help us work faster and smarter. The trouble is that putting each piece in place to begin a new project can take time. So far, I haven't seen a boilerplate that sets up a blank canvas with everything I wanted ready to go.

What's the problem?

Bootstrap is heavy, and contains lots of ready-made components that have to be redesigned. It's often overkill; too much. HTML5 Boilerplate comes with some great page defaults but isn't enough to get you working on what makes this project unique right away. Tools like Grunt are amazing, but can take quite some time to get set up.

I want something that remains lightweight but that is powerful: a grid system that leaves my markup alone, a useful set of essential mixins, a stark template that serves as a blank canvas, the extras I need to support older browsers, and ready to go build tools. I want to clone it, run a few setup commands, and begin work.

This is Substrata

A barebones skeleton for your next web project. A set of Less, JS and HTML starting files that target the sweet spot between too much and too little. A set of configuration files to get you up and running quickly with a reasonably modern workflow. It gets you going, and gets out of the way.

Key Features

  • Very lightweight
  • Simple, Responsive and Semantic Grid
  • Few design styles...
  • ...just basic clean typography
  • Google Web Fonts Code
  • Analytics Code
  • Example Media Query Break Points
  • HTML5 Boilerplate .htaccess file
  • Gruntfile with watch, build and server tasks
  • Compile Jade, Less, CoffeeScript
  • Page and blog post static site generation
  • Easily extend these features or add other languages
